intro: Sauvagesia inconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous sauvagesia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, and prefers moist, well-drained soils. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a rough texture, making it distinctive in its native environment.
